policies.name: Wireless Access Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy establishing usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for all types of wireless access to organizational systems
policies.rationale: NIST 03.01.16 requires 'establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of wireless access' necessitating formal policy guidance

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: High-level organizational policy governing all access control measures including wireless access
policies.rationale: Parent policy providing overarching access control governance for all AC family controls

procedures.name: Wireless Access Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for authorizing each type of wireless access to the system prior to establishing connections
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to establishing such connections'

procedures.name: Wireless Configuration Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for configuring wireless networks with strong authentication protocols and encryption, including WPA3-Enterprise or equivalent
procedures.rationale: Control mandates 'protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption' requiring specific configuration procedures

procedures.name: Wireless Device Deployment Procedure
procedures.description: Process for disabling unnecessary wireless capabilities (WiFi, Bluetooth, NFC) on devices prior to issuance and deployment
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'disable, when not intended for use, wireless networking capabilities prior to issuance and deployment'

executionEvidence.name: Wireless Access Authorization Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: type of wireless access requested, business justification, security requirements verified, approver signature, authorization date, device/user identifiers
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates compliance with requirement to 'authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to establishing such connections'

executionEvidence.name: Wireless Network Configuration Audit Reports
executionEvidence.description: Technical reports showing: wireless SSIDs in use, authentication method configured (WPA3-Enterprise, 802.1X), encryption protocols enabled, guest network isolation verified, rogue access point scan results
executionEvidence.rationale: Validates ongoing compliance with authentication and encryption requirements; quarterly aligns with CIS Benchmark recommendations for wireless security reviews

executionEvidence.name: Pre-Deployment Wireless Capability Reports
executionEvidence.description: Checklists showing: device make/model, wireless capabilities present (WiFi, Bluetooth, NFC), capabilities disabled per policy, technician signature, deployment date
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves compliance with 'disable wireless networking capabilities prior to issuance and deployment' requirement

executionEvidence.name: Wireless Authentication Logs
executionEvidence.description: System logs showing: successful/failed wireless authentication attempts, user/device identifiers, authentication method used, connection timestamps, MAC addresses
executionEvidence.rationale: Provides evidence of authentication enforcement; 30-day retention aligns with minimum log retention for security monitoring

executionEvidence.name: Wireless Encryption Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: Technical scans showing: wireless networks detected, encryption protocols in use, cipher strength verified (AES-256 or equivalent), weak encryption identified and remediated
executionEvidence.rationale: Validates encryption requirement compliance; monthly scanning recommended by SP 800-97 for wireless security monitoring

operationalActivities: Review and approve wireless access authorization requests based on business need
Configure wireless networks with WPA3-Enterprise or WPA2-Enterprise using 802.1X authentication
Implement AES-256 encryption for all wireless traffic
Disable WiFi, Bluetooth, NFC on devices where not required for business functions
Conduct quarterly wireless configuration audits and rogue access point scans
Monitor wireless authentication logs for anomalous activity
Verify encryption protocols monthly through technical scanning
Update wireless access authorizations when device type or user role changes

policies.name: Mobile Device Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy establishing usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for mobile devices including smartphones, tablets, and smart watches
policies.rationale: NIST 03.01.18 requires 'establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for mobile devices' necessitating comprehensive mobile device governance

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: High-level organizational policy governing access control measures for all device types
policies.rationale: Parent policy providing overarching access control governance for mobile device controls

procedures.name: Mobile Device Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for authorizing mobile device connections to organizational systems, including device registration, security verification, and user agreement acknowledgment
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'authorize the connection of mobile devices to the system' necessitating formal authorization workflow

procedures.name: Mobile Device Configuration Procedure
procedures.description: Process for configuring mobile devices with required security settings including: mandatory passcode/biometric authentication, automatic screen lock, remote wipe capability, prohibited app categories, required protective software
procedures.rationale: Control mandates usage restrictions and configuration requirements per NIST discussion of 'configuration management, device identification and authentication, implementing mandatory protective software'

procedures.name: Mobile Device Encryption Implementation Procedure
procedures.description: Process for implementing and verifying full-device encryption (iOS FileVault, Android encryption) or container-based encryption (Microsoft Intune, VMware Workspace ONE) to protect CUI confidentiality
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'implement full-device or container-based encryption to protect the confidentiality of CUI on mobile devices'

executionEvidence.name: Mobile Device Registration and Authorization Records
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: device make/model/OS version, device owner name, authorization date, approver, intended use, MDM enrollment status, acceptable use policy acknowledgment
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates compliance with 'authorize the connection of mobile devices to the system' requirement

executionEvidence.name: Mobile Device Configuration Compliance Reports
executionEvidence.description: MDM reports showing: enrolled devices list, passcode/biometric enabled status, encryption status (full-device or container), automatic lock timeout configured, prohibited apps detected, non-compliant devices quarantined
executionEvidence.rationale: Validates ongoing adherence to configuration requirements; monthly reporting standard for MDM compliance monitoring per SP 800-124

executionEvidence.name: Mobile Device Encryption Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: Technical reports showing: device identifier, encryption method (full-device vs container), encryption algorithm verified (AES-256), CUI storage location, encryption status (active/inactive), non-compliant devices identified
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves compliance with encryption requirement for CUI protection; quarterly verification aligns with CIS Mobile Device Management Benchmark

executionEvidence.name: MDM Policy Enforcement Logs
executionEvidence.description: System logs showing: policy violations detected, non-compliant device access blocked, remote wipe commands issued, configuration drift remediated, user notifications sent
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates active enforcement of mobile device restrictions; 30-day review cycle aligns with security monitoring best practices

operationalActivities: Review and approve mobile device connection authorization requests
Enroll authorized mobile devices in MDM solution
Configure mandatory security settings: minimum passcode length (8+ characters), biometric authentication, auto-lock (15 minutes max), remote wipe capability
Implement full-device encryption (iOS/Android native) or container-based encryption (Intune, Workspace ONE)
Verify encryption status quarterly for all devices accessing or storing CUI
Monitor MDM compliance reports monthly and quarantine non-compliant devices
Block installation of high-risk app categories (jailbreak detection, unauthorized cloud storage)
Issue remote wipe commands for lost/stolen devices within 24 hours of report
Conduct annual mobile device security assessments per device type/OS

policies.name: External System Use Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy prohibiting use of external systems unless specifically authorized, and establishing security requirements for authorized external systems including personally-owned devices, contractor systems, and third-party systems
policies.rationale: NIST 03.01.20 requires 'prohibit the use of external systems unless the systems are specifically authorized' and 'establish security requirements to be satisfied on external systems' necessitating comprehensive policy governance

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: High-level organizational policy governing access to organizational systems from external systems
policies.rationale: Parent policy providing overarching access control framework for external system usage

procedures.name: External System Authorization Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for reviewing external system authorization requests, verifying business need, assessing trust relationships, and approving/denying access
procedures.rationale: Control requires determining which external systems are specifically authorized for use with organizational systems

procedures.name: External System Security Verification Procedure
procedures.description: Process for verifying external systems meet organizational security requirements before access is granted, including: OS patch level, antivirus status, encryption verification, configuration compliance assessment
procedures.rationale: Control mandates 'verifying that the security requirements on the external systems as specified in the organization's system security plans have been satisfied'

procedures.name: System Connection Agreement Management Procedure
procedures.description: Process for creating, reviewing, approving, and maintaining system connection or processing agreements with entities hosting external systems, including terms and conditions, shared responsibilities, and security requirements
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'retaining approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entities hosting the external systems'

procedures.name: Portable Storage Device Control Procedure
procedures.description: Process for restricting use of organization-controlled portable storage devices (USB drives, external hard drives) on external systems, including device authorization, encryption verification, and usage logging
procedures.rationale: Control explicitly requires 'restrict the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems'

executionEvidence.name: External System Authorization Records
executionEvidence.description: Documentation showing: external system description (personally-owned, contractor, cloud service), requesting user/business unit, business justification, security requirements applicable, risk assessment results, approver signature, authorization date, expiration date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates compliance with requirement to specifically authorize external systems before use

executionEvidence.name: External System Security Verification Reports
executionEvidence.description: Assessment reports showing: system identifier, OS version and patch status, antivirus/EDR status, encryption enabled, firewall configured, security requirements checklist completed, verification date, verifier signature, compliance status (pass/fail)
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves security requirements are verified before access granted and reverified annually; aligns with control requirement to verify security requirements satisfaction

executionEvidence.name: System Connection and Processing Agreements
executionEvidence.description: Formal agreements showing: external entity name, system description, services provided, security requirements defined, shared responsibilities documented, data handling requirements, incident response procedures, agreement effective date, signatures, annual review date
executionEvidence.rationale: Control mandates 'retaining approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entities hosting the external systems'

executionEvidence.name: Portable Storage Device Usage Logs
executionEvidence.description: Records showing: device serial number, assigned user, usage on external system (approved/denied), external system identifier, date/time of use, data transferred (if any), justification for use
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates enforcement of portable storage device restrictions on external systems; 90-day freshness allows quarterly review cycles

executionEvidence.name: External System Compliance Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Annual review reports showing: list of all authorized external systems, compliance status for each, security requirement changes, expired authorizations identified, reauthorization recommendations, reviewer signature
executionEvidence.rationale: Ensures external system authorizations remain valid and security requirements continue to be met; annual reviews align with standard security assessment cycles

operationalActivities: Review external system authorization requests and assess business justification
Verify external systems meet security requirements before granting access: current OS patches, antivirus enabled, encryption configured, firewall active
Create and maintain system connection agreements with external system owners defining security requirements and shared responsibilities
Implement technical controls (NAC, VPN) to enforce external system security requirements before network access
Monitor and log portable storage device usage on external systems
Restrict or block organization-controlled USB devices from connecting to non-authorized external systems
Conduct annual reviews of all external system authorizations and security verification status
Revoke external system access when authorization expires or security requirements no longer met
Update security requirements for external systems as threat landscape evolves

policies.name: Information Disclosure Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy governing what information can be published to publicly accessible systems and prohibiting disclosure of CUI to unauthorized parties
policies.rationale: NIST 03.01.22 requires ensuring 'publicly accessible information does not contain CUI' necessitating formal disclosure governance

policies.name: CUI Handling Policy
policies.description: Organizational policy defining CUI categories, marking requirements, authorized storage locations, and prohibitions on public disclosure
policies.rationale: Control emphasizes that 'the public is not authorized to have access to nonpublic information, including CUI' requiring clear CUI handling policy

policies.name: Access Control Policy
policies.description: High-level organizational policy governing access to information including public disclosure controls
policies.rationale: Parent policy providing overarching access control framework for information disclosure

procedures.name: Public Content Review Procedure
procedures.description: Step-by-step process for reviewing content on publicly accessible systems (websites, social media, public file shares) to identify and remove CUI, including review frequency, responsible parties, and escalation process
procedures.rationale: Control requires 'review the content on publicly accessible systems for CUI and remove such information, if discovered'

procedures.name: CUI Identification and Removal Procedure
procedures.description: Process for identifying CUI in public content, documenting discovery, immediately removing content, investigating how CUI was published, and implementing corrective actions
procedures.rationale: Control mandates removing CUI when discovered on publicly accessible systems

procedures.name: Public Content Publishing Procedure
procedures.description: Process for reviewing and approving content before publication to public systems, including CUI screening checklist, content approver requirements, and publication workflow
procedures.rationale: Preventive control supporting requirement to ensure publicly accessible information does not contain CUI

executionEvidence.name: Public Content Review Reports
executionEvidence.description: Reports showing: systems reviewed (websites, social media accounts, public repositories), review date, pages/posts reviewed, CUI identified (if any), removal actions taken, reviewer signature, next scheduled review date
executionEvidence.rationale: Demonstrates ongoing compliance with review requirement; monthly reviews provide reasonable detection window while being operationally feasible

executionEvidence.name: CUI Training Completion Records for Content Publishers
executionEvidence.description: Training records showing: employee name, training date, topics covered (CUI identification, marking, handling, public disclosure prohibitions), quiz score (80%+ required), certificate number, annual renewal date
executionEvidence.rationale: Control requires 'train authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain CUI' - annual training standard for security awareness per 03.02.01

executionEvidence.name: CUI Incident Reports for Public Disclosure
executionEvidence.description: Incident reports showing: CUI discovered in public content, content description, publication date, discovery date, removal timestamp (within 1 hour target), root cause analysis, responsible party, corrective actions implemented, incident closure date
executionEvidence.frequency: Per incident (when CUI found in public content)
executionEvidence.rationale: Documents CUI removal actions and demonstrates response effectiveness when violations occur

executionEvidence.name: Public Content Publishing Approval Records
executionEvidence.description: Approval records showing: content description, intended publication location, CUI screening checklist completed, approver name, approval date, publication date, content URL
executionEvidence.rationale: Proves preventive controls are in place to screen content for CUI before publication

executionEvidence.name: Automated CUI Detection Scan Results
executionEvidence.description: If using DLP or content scanning tools: scan results showing public content scanned, CUI patterns detected, false positive review, alerts generated, remediation status
executionEvidence.rationale: Provides continuous monitoring for CUI in public content; weekly scanning provides timely detection while managing alert fatigue

operationalActivities: Provide annual CUI awareness training to all personnel authorized to publish content to public systems
Conduct monthly manual reviews of public websites, social media accounts, and public file repositories for CUI
Implement pre-publication approval workflow requiring CUI screening checklist completion
Configure DLP tools to monitor public-facing systems for CUI patterns and generate alerts
Immediately remove CUI from public content when discovered (within 1 hour of detection)
Investigate root cause when CUI is found in public content and implement corrective actions
Maintain inventory of all public-facing systems requiring CUI monitoring
Document all public content reviews with evidence of pages/systems checked and findings
Review and update CUI identification training materials annually to reflect new CUI categories
